item.title: Martian Frost Detection Project
item.description:
Overview

Utilized JPL data to identify Martian surface frost. Trained a CNN model with EfficientNetB0, ResNet50, and VGG16 using transfer learning. Achieved a 91% accuracy with EfficientNetB0.

Key Steps

  1. Data Processing: Preprocessed JPL data, adjusting for lighting and normalizing sizes.

  2. CNN Training: Developed a CNN model for automatic frost identification, employing data augmentation.

  3. Transfer Learning: Fine-tuned EfficientNetB0, ResNet50, and VGG16 on Martian frost dataset.

  4. Optimization: Achieved 91% accuracy with EfficientNetB0 through hyperparameter tuning.

  5. Performance Evaluation: Evaluated models on a test set, analyzing metrics such as precision, recall and F1-score.

  6. Deployment: Deployed EfficientNetB0 model for real-time Martian frost detection.

Outcome

Successful application of ML techniques to JPL data, enhancing understanding of Martian surface conditions.

GitHub Link

item.title: The Elite Game
item.description:
As the team leader, I’m excited to showcase our latest game project, “The Elite Game,” developed using C# and Unity. This 2D platformer game promises an engaging and challenging gaming experience.

Game Highlights

  1. 2D Platformer: “The Elite Game” is a 2D platformer that seamlessly blends precision jumping with strategic thinking.

  2. 10 Levels to Conquer: Players embark on a thrilling journey through 10 progressively challenging levels, each presenting a unique set of obstacles and puzzles to solve.

  3. Strategic Gameplay: Success in “The Elite Game” relies on quick thinking. Green and blue timers constantly change, indicating the safety of platforms. Players must calculate jumps and make decisions based on timer colors and available safe paths.

  4. Rewarding Progression: As players advance, they unlock new abilities and power-ups, adding depth to the gameplay and enabling creative approaches to level completion.

  5. Immersive Visuals and Sound: The game features captivating 2D graphics and an immersive sound design, enhancing the overall gaming experience.

Explore the game here and immerse yourself in the world of “The Elite Game”!

item.title: Event Finder
item.description:
Introducing EventFinder, my web development project designed to streamline event discovery.

ðŸŽ¯ Key Features

  1. Event Search: Effortlessly find local concerts, sports events, and cultural festivals.

  2. Event Details: Access comprehensive event information, including date, time, venue, and performers.

  3. Favorites List: Curate a personalized favorites list to stay updated on must-attend events.

  4. API Integration: Leveraging TicketMaster Discovery API for real-time event data.

  5. Artist Discovery: Integrated Spotify API for exploring artists performing at events.

  6. Cross-Platform Accessibility: Accessible on both web and Android platforms for user convenience.

Explore EventFinder now and discover a seamless way to stay informed about the latest events!

item.title: Smart Attendence System using Sound waves
item.description:
This project was undertaken as part of my academic curriculum and involves a system for efficient classroom attendance management. The workflow is outlined below:

  1. Teacher Sign-in:

    • The teacher starts by opening the mobile app and signing in using their unique teacher ID.

  2. Student Sign-in:

    • Students can sign in to the same application using their designated student ID.

  3. Attendance Marking:

    • The teacher initiates attendance by pressing a sound-emitting button on their smartphone.
    • The emitted sound waves are received by the students’ smartphones, marking their attendance once received.

Technology Stack

The project incorporates the following technologies:

  • Development Platform: Android Studio
  • Programming Language: Java
  • Database Management: MySQL (for storing student records)
  • Security: RSA Encryption Algorithm (to maintain the confidentiality of student data)

item.title: Image denoising Using CNN
item.description:
This project was undertaken during the Gujarat Industrial Hackathon conducted on March 21, 2019. The primary focus was on enhancing the video quality of surveillance cameras at night through the implementation of a machine learning model. The project details are as follows:

  1. Objective:

    • Designing a machine learning model to improve the video quality captured by surveillance cameras during nighttime.

  2. Implementation:

    • Utilized the Python programming language for project implementation.
    • Worked with computer vision libraries in Python to develop a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN).

  3. Training Process:

    • Trained the model by processing each frame of a video footage and implementing denoising techniques.

  4. Outcome:

    • Produced a clarified video output, enhancing visibility, particularly useful for emergency situations and law enforcement.

Technology Stack

The technologies employed in this project include:

  • Programming Language: Python
  • Machine Learning Model: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
  • Computer Vision Libraries: OpenCV, NumPy, Matplotlib, SciPy.

item.title: RFID-based smart mall
item.description:
This project was accomplished during the Gujarat Industrial Hackathon held on February 12, 2018. It successfully qualified for the final round, surpassing 500+ participating teams. The objective of the project was to enhance the efficiency of the shopping experience by associating RFID tags with every product in the mall. The system’s workflow is outlined below:

  1. Customer Checkout:

    • After completing their shopping, customers proceed to the billing counter.

  2. RFID-Based Scanning:

    • The billing counter is equipped with an RFID-based door.
    • As customers pass through, all items are automatically scanned using RFID tags.

  3. Automatic Billing:

    • The total cost of all scanned items is displayed, and customers can make the payment, reducing the time spent on manual scanning.

Technology Stack

The technologies used in developing this system include:

  • RFID Scanner: Arduino UNO
  • Programming Language: C (for coding Arduino UNO)
  • RFID Technology: RFID Chips
  • Database Management: MySQL (for storing customer records)
